sources.data_found: Lawrence runs the Rocky Linux operating system and is made up of over 2,300 CPU cores, including systems with 1.5TB of memory, GPU accelerators, and over 400TB of shared high-speed data storage accessible via a 56Gb FDR Infiniband network.
Research Computing Group at the University of South Dakota maintains a research computing cluster.

Student enrollment in the University of South Dakota's computer science programs has skyrocketed. Between fall 2021 and fall 2022, the number of undergraduate students grew 39% while the number of graduate students expanded by an astounding 184%.

USD's overall headcount reached a new milestone with 10,619 students enrolled, a 7.6% increase from the previous year. Popular undergraduate majors among the entering classes included business, nursing, computer science, and medical biology.
The university has a student body of over 15,000 students, including over 7,000 undergraduate students and over 8,000 graduate students.

student_data.notes: Based on CS enrollment growth data: Between fall 2021 and fall 2022, undergraduate CS students grew 39% and graduate students expanded by 184%. Computer science is listed as one of the highest enrollment graduate programs at USD. CS is also mentioned as a popular major among entering undergraduate classes. Specific CS student counts are estimated based on: (1) typical CS department size at similar universities (~2-3% of total undergrad enrollment), (2) USD's total undergrad enrollment of 7,619 students (fall 2024), and (3) the reported significant growth trends. Undergraduate CS estimated at ~150 students (2% of undergrad enrollment), Graduate CS estimated at ~120 students based on it being a high-enrollment graduate program. PhD CS count not found in available data.

other_high_vram_gpus.notes: Lawrence cluster includes GPU-accelerated nodes per multiple sources, but specific GPU models and quantities were not publicly documented. The cluster was built in 2017 with a $704,000 grant, suggesting older generation GPUs (likely Tesla V100 or P100 era based on deployment date).

gpu_resources.notes: The Lawrence HPC cluster at USD includes GPU accelerators according to multiple sources, but exact GPU specifications (model, quantity, memory) are not publicly available on the university websites. The cluster was deployed in 2017 by Advanced Clustering Technologies with over 2,300 CPU cores, GPU-accelerated nodes, interactive visualization nodes, and 60+ TFLOPS performance. Given the 2017 deployment date, GPUs are likely older generation (V100 or P100). [WARNING: Original source was inaccessible, using fallback.]

analysis_notes: University of South Dakota's Lawrence HPC cluster includes GPU resources, but specific GPU specifications are not publicly documented. Multiple sources confirm GPU-accelerated nodes exist but do not specify models or quantities. CS enrollment data shows strong growth with 39% undergraduate and 184% graduate growth from 2021 to 2022, making CS one of the highest enrollment graduate programs. Specific CS student counts estimated based on typical department sizes and growth trends.
